text: Harriet Lucy Mathews (born 22 December 1973) is a British diplomat. Mathews was educated at South Hampstead High School and the University of York. She entered the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) in 1997.MATHEWS, Harriet Lucy, Who's Who 2017, A & C Black, 2017 (online edition, Oxford University Press, 2016) In June 2015 Mathews became the Ambassador of the United Kingdom to Somalia. In 2016 the FCO announced that she was to transfer to another Diplomatic Service appointment, and she left Somalia on 30 December 2016. Mathews was appointed Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE) in 2005, and Companion of the Order of St Michael and St George (CMG) "for services to Diplomacy, International Peace and Security and the UK response to the Ebola crisis" in the 2017 New Year Honours. ==References== Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:People educated at South Hampstead High School Category:Alumni of the University of York Category:Ambassadors of the United Kingdom to Somalia Category:British women ambassadors Category:Companions of the Order of St Michael and St George Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire
title: Harriet Mathews
